Tin Hong Si Temple

Town
Masjid Jamek, Kajang

Kajang, Malaysia

Let's get to know about Kajang!

  • After the Klang War, also known as the Selangor Civil War, Kajang was created in 1807.
  • Kajang has a stadium called 'Stadium Kajang', also known as 'Kajang Square'. The stadium, which was built in the 1970s, hosted numerous notable football matches involving Malaysian luminaries. The stadium was then demolished and replaced with a public square featuring jogging tracks and a children's playground.
  • Lieutenant Adnan Saidi, a war hero known for his gallantry in the Battle of Bukit Chandu, was born in Kajang.
  • Kajang is also famous for producing local celebrities. Both Ning Baizura and Nora Danish went to the same school – SMK Convent Kajang.
  • In 1971, SMK Tinggi Kajang, also known as Kajang High School, discovered an underground tunnel. During the Japanese invasion, the hidden tunnel was built, and it is thought to connect to other schools in the vicinity.
  • Kajang has several Mass Rapid Transit(MRT) stations located in Sungai Jernih, Bandar Kajang and Jalan Reko. MRT is a planned rapid transit system in Malaysia.
  • Kajang is also known for its famous Satay. Among the top restaurants serving Kajang’s best eksport is Haji Samuri Sate Restaurant. Click here to know more about this food!
